gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GTC shipboard CTD data along the US GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect from the R/V Thomas G. Thompson TN303 cruise in the tropical Pacific from Peru to Tahiti during 2013 (U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT project)

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: Cite this dataset as: Moffett, James, Cutter, Gregory and German, Christopher (2014) GTC shipboard CTD data along the US GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect from the R/V Thomas G. Thompson TN303 cruise in the tropical Pacific from Peru to Tahiti during 2013 (U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT project). Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO). Dataset version 2014-10-30 [if applicable, indicate subset used]. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset/522668 [access date]

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: CTD - GT-C Shipboard SBE-Processed Files Dataset Description: <p>CTD - GT-C Shipboard SBE-Processed Files</p><p><strong>Data are currently RESTRICTED.<br />Contact Chief Sci/PI for access.</strong></p><p><strong>srg/12Aug2014</strong></p> Acquisition Description: <p>From the TN303 cruise report:<br />Two types of rosette/SBE9plus CTD casts (ODF/30L-Niskin and GT-C/12L-GoFlo) were made at 36 station locations during U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT.</p><p>Shipboard CTD data processing was performed automatically at the end of each deployment using&nbsp;SIO/STS CTD processing software v.5.1.6-1. Raw GT-C CTD data and bottle trip files, acquired by SBE&nbsp;Seasave V 7.17a on a Windows XP workstation, were also imported into the Linux processing system,&nbsp;providing a backup of the raw data.</p><p>At the end of the cruise, all GT-C CTD&nbsp;data were updated in the database using the post-cast Seasave-processed&nbsp;".btl" file 5-second averaged CTD data, in order to include processed CTD Oxygen values.&nbsp;The 5-second average used resulted in slightly better agreement between CTD and GoFlo salinity values&nbsp;than the shorter 3-second average used for the Niskin rosette.</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Division of Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1235248 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1235248&HistoricalAwards=false
Funding provided by NSF Division of Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1130870 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1130870&HistoricalAwards=false

Eastern Tropical Pacific - Transect from Peru to Tahiti

Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

Description: Parameters quantifying the flow of electrical current through or the electrical resistance of a body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: CTD Dataset Identifier; General Description: dataset_id: a unique combination of alpha and/or numeric characters designating a dataset (filename in many cases)

PI-supplied Description: expedition code assigned by the CCHDO: NODCShipCodeYearMonthDay; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.

PI-supplied Description: cruise section identification number; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES Event Number; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Station Date (GMT); General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

PI-supplied Description: Station Time (GMT); General Description: Time GMT defined as HHMM; time of day; generally reported in GMT as HHMM (hours and minutes) but may also be HH.H (decimal hours) or HHMMSS (hours; minutes and seconds); in EqPac time is reported as Hawaii local time NERC Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event.

PI-supplied Description: Station Latitude (South is negative); General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Station Longitude (West is negative); General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Pressure Digiquartz; General Description: water pressure at measurement; depth reported as pressure; positive number increasing with water depth NERC Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column.

PI-supplied Description: Temperature ITS-90; General Description: water temperature at measurement depth NERC Description: The degree of hotness at any position within a volume of fresh or salt water expressed against the International Temperature Scale 1990 (ITS-90) calibration standard.

PI-supplied Description: Temperature 2 ITS-90; General Description: water temperature at measurement depth NERC Description: The degree of hotness at any position within a volume of fresh or salt water expressed against the International Temperature Scale 1990 (ITS-90) calibration standard.

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: conductivity from the CTD primary sensor

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Electrical conductivity of the water column

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: conductivity from the CTD primary sensor

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Conductivity; General Description: conductivity, from the CTD 'primary sensor', usually reported in Siemens/meter. Depending on input source may have a variety of names. NERC Description: Parameters quantifying the flow of electrical current through or the electrical resistance of a body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: conductivity from the CTD primary sensor

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Electrical conductivity of the water column

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: conductivity from the CTD primary sensor

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Conductivity 2; General Description: conductivity, from the CTD 'primary sensor', usually reported in Siemens/meter. Depending on input source may have a variety of names. NERC Description: Parameters quantifying the flow of electrical current through or the electrical resistance of a body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere
PI-supplied Description: Oxygen raw SBE 43; General Description: Oxygen voltage
PI-supplied Description: Beam Transmission Chelsea/Seatech; General Description: light transmission, as percent

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Concentration of chlorophyll-a {chl-a} per unit volume of the water body [particulate phase] by in-situ chlorophyll fluorometer and manufacturer's calibration applied

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Fluorescence Seapoint; General Description: fluorescence; indirect measure of pigment concentration; possibly calibrated against extracted pigment concentrations; units may vary with dataset; for US JGOFS fluorescence as measured from CTD instrument sensor NERC Description: In-situ fluorometer with manufacturer calibration applied.
PI-supplied Description: Turbidity Seapoint; General Description: Turbidity is the cloudiness or haziness of a fluid caused by individual particles

PI-supplied Description: Depth salt water lat = -12.0057; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Salinity Practical; General Description: salinity, calculated from the CTD 'primary sensors' of conductivity and temperature, Practical Salinity Scale (PSS-78), dimensionless. Depending on the input source, salinity from the primary sensors can have a variety of names i.e. s0, s00, sal0, sal00. NERC Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code.

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Salinity 2 Practical; General Description: salinity, calculated from the CTD 'primary sensors' of conductivity and temperature, Practical Salinity Scale (PSS-78), dimensionless. Depending on the input source, salinity from the primary sensors can have a variety of names i.e. s0, s00, sal0, sal00. NERC Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code.
PI-supplied Description: Density (density); General Description: density, kilograms/meter^3
PI-supplied Description: Density 2 (density); General Description: density, kilograms/meter^3

PI-supplied Description: Density sigma-theta; General Description: sigma_theta density. [The density calculated with in situ salinity, potential temperature, and pressure = 0, minus 1000 kg/m3.If a pressure reference level other than the surface is used, it will be indicated by using the reference level as the subscriptfor sigma. When comparing the density of water samples from different depths, it is preferable to use sigma-theta. - added 11/15/2013, njc from the Naval Postgraduate School, http://www.oc.nps.edu/nom/day1/parta.html]

PI-supplied Description: Density 2 sigma-theta; General Description: sigma_theta density. [The density calculated with in situ salinity, potential temperature, and pressure = 0, minus 1000 kg/m3.If a pressure reference level other than the surface is used, it will be indicated by using the reference level as the subscriptfor sigma. When comparing the density of water samples from different depths, it is preferable to use sigma-theta. - added 11/15/2013, njc from the Naval Postgraduate School, http://www.oc.nps.edu/nom/day1/parta.html]
PI-supplied Description: Oxygen SBE 43 WS = 2; General Description: dissolved oxygen; e.g. measurement from a high resolution CTD instrument

PI-supplied Description: Flag; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date/Time (ISO formatted); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>From the TN303 cruise report:<br />Two types of rosette/SBE9plus CTD casts (ODF/30L-Niskin and GT-C/12L-GoFlo) were made at 36 station locations during U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT.</p><p>Shipboard CTD data processing was performed automatically at the end of each deployment using&nbsp;SIO/STS CTD processing software v.5.1.6-1. Raw GT-C CTD data and bottle trip files, acquired by SBE&nbsp;Seasave V 7.17a on a Windows XP workstation, were also imported into the Linux processing system,&nbsp;providing a backup of the raw data.</p><p>At the end of the cruise, all GT-C CTD&nbsp;data were updated in the database using the post-cast Seasave-processed&nbsp;".btl" file 5-second averaged CTD data, in order to include processed CTD Oxygen values.&nbsp;The 5-second average used resulted in slightly better agreement between CTD and GoFlo salinity values&nbsp;than the shorter 3-second average used for the Niskin rosette.</p>

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: Instrument Name: CTD Sea-Bird SEACAT 19 Instrument Short Name:CTD SBE 19 Instrument Description: The Sea-Bird SBE 19 SEACAT Recorder measures conductivity, temperature, and pressure (depth). The SEACAT is self-powered and self-contained and can be deployed in profiling or moored mode. The SBE 19 SEACAT was replaced in 2001 by the 19plus. more information from Sea-Bird Electronics Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L22/current/TOOL0042/
